Package net.sf.cotelab.playingcards.javafx

Class ImageFactory

java.lang.Object
net.sf.cotelab.playingcards.javafx.ImageFactory
public class ImageFactory extends Object
A provider of Image objects. This object maintains a cache of Image objects, for performance reasons.

  • Constructor Details

    • ImageFactory

      public ImageFactory()
      Construct a new object with default settings.

    • ImageFactory

      public ImageFactory(double maxDim)
      Construct a new object with a specified maximum dimension. While the new object will preserve aspect ratio, the images produced will be limited in height and width to the specified maximum dimension.
      Parameters:
      maxDim - the maximum dimension.

  • Method Details

    • flush

      public void flush()
      Flush the cache.

    • getImage

      public javafx.scene.image.Image getImage(String url)
      Get an image from the given URL.
      Parameters:
      url - the image source.
      Returns:
      the image (null if the image cannot be retrieved).

    • loadImage

      protected javafx.scene.image.Image loadImage(String url)
      Load an image from a given URL.
      Parameters:

      Returns:
      the new object.

    • newMap_String_Image

      protected Map<String,javafx.scene.image.Image> newMap_String_Image()
      Construct a new Map<String, Image>.
      Returns:
      the new object.

    • newImage

      protected javafx.scene.image.Image newImage(String url, double requestedWidth, double requestedHeight, boolean preserveRatio, boolean smooth)
      Create a new Image.
      Parameters:
      url - the string representing the URL to use in fetching the pixel data.
      requestedWidth - the image's bounding box width.
      requestedHeight - the image's bounding box height.
      preserveRatio - indicates whether to preserve the aspect ratio of the original image when scaling to fit the image within the specified bounding box.
      smooth - indicates whether to use a better quality filtering algorithm or a faster one when scaling this image to fit within the specified bounding box.
      Returns:
      the new object.
